caption: (Ad) Who’s up for a comforting warming winter salad bowl? 🥗 I’ve teamed up with @naturescharm to bring you all a super delicious recipe using their jackfruit confit. This jackfruit so tender and flavorful so even if you’re like me and rarely cook with jackfruit I highly recommend trying it out! This recipe serves 2 people✨ I’ve included a step by step guide for all components below but will also be putting it on the blog where it might be easier to read. Here’s how to make it! Roasted brussel sprouts: 300g brussels sprouts 1tsp maple syrup 1tsp rosemary salt + pepper 0.5 tbsp balsamic vinegar 1tbsp olive oil How to: Slice brussels sprouts in half, massage in the rest of your ingredients and roast at 200C for 40 minutes. ✨ Croutons: 80g bread cut into cubes 1 tbsp olive oil 0.25 tsp dried thyme A good sprinkle of salt and pepper How to: Toss all ingredients together and bake on a tray lined with parchment paper for 20 mins at 200C. ✨ Dressing: 1 tsp balsamic vinegar 1 tsp maple syrup 0.5 tsp lemon juice How to: Whisk together in a bowl ✨ Other ingredients: 150g Kale Salt and pepper 2tsp olive oil 0.5 tsp garlic powder 2 tins @naturescharm Jackfruit Confit 1 tbsp pumpkin seeds 1 tbsp dried cranberries How to: Destem and chop the kale into bite sized pieces. Massage in 2tsp olive oil and a good sprinkle of salt and pepper. Cook until slightly crispy in a pan. Cook the jackfruit confit according to the instructions on the tin. Assemble by tossing the brussels sprouts, croutons and kale together in a bowl, add the jackfruit, sprinkle on pumpkin seeds and cranberries and drizzle over the dressing. Hope you enjoy! I had another fun day of recipe creating this week and I’m so excited to share the recipe for this creamy tahini noodle salad with you all in collaboration with @sharethefantastic! This salad is honestly so creamy, delicious and easy to make. Perfect for those lazy days where you still want to eat properly. Ingredients: -2 blocks @Sharethefantastic instant noodles -70g Carrot -80g deshelled edamame beans -70g Spinach -100g Cucumber -1 tbsp Black sesame seeds -Scallions for garnish Dressing: -1 tbsp tahini -2 tsp Rice vinegar -2 tsp Maple syrup -1 tbsp Soy sauce -1 clove Garlic -1 tsp Ginger -1 tbsp water -1 pinch chili flakes.  First, cook your noodles according to package instructions. Chop your veggies, defrost and deshell (if necessary) your edamame and set aside. Finely mince your garlic and combine all ingredients for the dressing in a small bowl. In a larger bowl, add your noodles, veggies, sesame seeds and dressing and toss to combine. Garnish with some scallions of you want and enjoy! #sharethefantastic #ad

Learning how to make comforting, flavourful and wholesome noodle dishes at home during self-isolation has been so much fun and I am so excited to share this recipe with you all in collaboration with Fantastic Snacks @sharethefantastic! Using only ingredients available at regular supermarkets this recipe is super easy to make and VERY tasty. Here’s how to do it: Ingredients: -1 head pak choi -150g Tofu -2tsp Sesame oil + 1tbsp sesame oil -1tsp five spice seasoning -2 cloves minced garlic -0.5 tsp Chili flakes* -1.5 tbsp Hoisin sauce -2 tbsp Soy sauce -0.25 cup Chinese Cooking wine -2 blocks @sharethefantastic instant noodles -1tbsp sesame seeds -Scallions (optional, for garnish) How to: Slice tofu and press between two paper towels to get rid of excess moisture. Fry in 1tsp sesame oil with salt and pepper. Then, cook pak choi in a pan with 1 tsp sesame oil, salt and pepper. Set aside. Cook @sharethefantastic instant noodles according to package instructions, rinse in cold water and set aside. Heat 1tbsp sesame oil in a pan. Add garlic and chili flakes and fry until garlic is golden. Add hoisin sauce, soy sauce and Shaoxing cooking wine and mix. Add noodles and sesame seeds and toss to combine. Cook until most of the liquid has evaporated and the noodles are coated in a thick sauce. Plate with tofu, pak choi and scallions. *adjust the amount of chili to your preferred spice level, you can also omit this completely. #ad #sharethefantastic

Self-isolation pasta and movie nights have definitely been one of my favourite ways to spend my evening as of late. Such a great way to connect with those you live with, or just treat yourself to a nice meal! My partner and I whipped up this puttanesca inspired pasta dish with some pantry friendly ingredients the other night and I’m so excited to share the recipe with you all in collaboration with @sanremopasta ! INGREDIENTS: -200g @sanremopasta penne -1x400g tin whole cherry tomatoes -50g olives -20g capers -3 cloves garlic -100g cannellini beans -70g kale -20ml olive oil -Salt + Pepper -Parsley (fresh or dried, for garnish) -2tbsp Pine nuts Heat your olive oil in a pan and add finely chopped garlic and cook until slightly golden. Add olives and capers and stir. Add cannellini beans and combine well. Keep cooking for a little while until everything is golden and fragrant. Rinse your tinned tomatoes, add to the pan and leave to simmer. Crush the tomatoes lightly with the back of your spoon to release more flavour. In a separate pot, cook your pasta according to package instructions. Once done, drain and add the pasta to your tomato sauce. Add the kale or any other greens of your choice and combine to wilt the kale. Gradually add around 200ml water to steam and wilt the kale. Add salt and pepper to taste at the end. Serve with dried or fresh parsley and pine nuts. #ad #sanremopasta #wearefamily

While searching through the barren shelves of our local Woolies Simon and I came across these really cool looking pasta spirals from @sanremopasta and decided to try them out. In relation to this I’m therefore super happy to be teaming up with @Sanremopasta to bring you all this pantry friendly recipe that will work with pretty much ANY similar sized pasta shape you have on hand, which is perfect in these times when it can be hard to find exactly what you want in the supermarket. CREAMY MUSHROOM PASTA INGREDIENTS: -200g Pasta (use any similar sized pasta shape you want) -3 cloves Garlic -200g Mushrooms -1 tsp Dried parsley -260 ml Soy milk -90g frozen peas (can sub with any green vegetable you have on hand) -Salt + pepper to taste -400 Vegetable stock -A drizzle of olive oil how to make: Slice your mushrooms into thin slices and finely chop your garlic. Add all ingredients to a pan (except from the salt and pepper) and bring to a simmer. Boil until the pasta is cooked and enough liquid has evaporated so you have a creamy, thick sauce. Then, season with salt and pepper to taste! Serve with some nuts and seeds. #ad BANOFFEE RICE CREAM PARFAITS! 🍫🥜🍌🍯«Riskrem» translated to «Rice Cream» in english is a traditional norwegian dessert that I decided to modernize a bit for this collaboration with my faves over at @naturescharm 🤩 No regrets there, these were SO YUMMY! (Full recipe can also be found on the blog for your convenience) Porridge Ingredients: -150 g short/medium grain rice -600 ml almond milk -2 tsp sugar -1 pinch of salt -1 tsp vanilla ✨ Whipped Cream + Toppings -1 can @naturescharm whipping cream -2 tsp sugar -1 banana -a jar of @naturescharm salted caramel sauce -Chocolate -Peanut butter  Start by making your porridge. Add all ingredients to a pot and simmer while stirring occasionally until it reaches a thick porridge consistency. Transfer to a bowl and leave to cool for a bit before putting it in the fridge and cooling it down completely. Whip up 1 can of refrigerated Natures Charm coconut whipping cream according to the instructions on the can with 2tsp sugar. Once porridge is cold, fold in 1 cup of coconut whipped cream into the porridge until evenly combined. Layer your rice cream with bananas, caramel sauce, shredded chocolate and any other toppings you might want in a glass and dig in! #ad BLACKBERRY CARDAMOM SCONES🤩🤩 I’m so happy to be bringing you all another recipe in collaboration with @naturescharm , and it just might be my favourite one yet! The full recipe is also on my blog in case you find it easier to read recipes on there☺️ Ingredients: -350g all purpose flour -100g vegan butter -2tbsp flax meal + 6 tbsp water -2 tsp baking powder -80g sugar -2 tsp cardamom -½ tsp salt -190g @naturescharm evaporated coconut milk -130g blackberries -2 tbsp @naturescharm condensed coconut milk. 🍫🍫🍫🍫 Chocolate cream: -80g dark choc -150g @naturescharm coconut whipping cream -1tsp maple syrup. Instructions: Mix flaxseeds with water and set aside. Combine flour, sugar, salt, baking powder and cardamom in a bowl. Add in chunks of cold vegan butter and use your fingers to pinch the lumps of butter until there are no chunks larger than the size of a pea, making sure not to melt them. Stir in the blackberries. Combine your evaporated coconut milk with the flax egg, whisk to combine and pour into your bowl. Mix until roughly incorporated before turning the dough onto a clean surface and kneading until just combined but still flaky and “rough” looking. Pat into a circular disc and cut into 8 equal “slices”. Place on a tray lined with parchment paper. Brush with slightly heated sweetened condensed coconut milk. Melt the dark chocolate in a bowl over a pot of boiling water. Once melted, stream in the coconut cream and maple syrup while whisking. Leave in the fridge to cool until thickened. Stir/whisk once more before serving to loosen it slightly.  Once cooled, serve your scone by slicing it in half, adding some chocolate cream and warm berries or jam. . . . . . . . . #vegan #veganfood #veganfoodshare #whatveganseat #food #plantbased #vegetarian #veganbreakfast #vegansofmelbourne #vegansofaustralia #melbournevegan #thrivemags #veganstudent #veganmealideas #melbournefoodblogger #melbournefoodie #melbournefood #scones #veganscones #baking #recipes #veganrecipes #veganrecipeshare #recipeshare #comfortfood #desserts #chocolate
